content: Thank you for the clarification, you bring up some interesting points. This first point being - we are digging into a whole deeper level of what influences the buyers decision, by going to the roots of what has shaped people decision making process. I concur with you in saying values aren’t always set in stone; these are just ulterior motives. The only way you can change values is through communication. Values which have been considered to be ‘set in stone’ I have seen shake to the core through communication. Some of these values include religion, politics, and others. Thank you for making me think a little bit deeper about this topic. It seems to be something you are quite well versed in and I appreciate you insights.
